address.addressline: Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

did.physdesc: 38.75 linear ft.(82 boxes), 1 oversized paper (OP), and 3 bound volumes (BV)
did.abstract: Papers of Eamon Grennan, Irish poet and professor, including correspondence, diaries, writings by Grennan, writings by others, teaching and lecture files, and printed material.
did.repository: Emory UniversityManuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Series 1: Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers.
Series 1: Due to privacy concerns, some materials in the series have been redacted.

userestrict.head: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Researchers may not quote from diaries in Series 4 without written permission from Grennan.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: [after identification of item(s)], Eamon Grennan papers, Manuscript, Archives, and Rare Book Library, Emory University.

processinfo.head: Processing
processinfo.p: Processed by Sarah Quigley, Rebecca Sherman and Sarah Clayton, 2012.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Eamon Grennan, Irish poet and professor, was born on November 13, 1941 in Dublin, Ireland, to Thomas P. and Evelyn Grennan. Grennan received a B.A. and M.A. in English from University College, Dublin, in 1963 and 1964 respectively. He lived in Rome from 1965-1966, then moved to the United States for graduate school. He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1973. He married Joan Perkins, whom he met in Rome, in 1972. The couple had two children, Kate Grennan and Conor Grennan. They divorced in 1985. He subsequently met long time companion, classicist Rachel Kitzinger, with whom he has one daughter, Kira Grennan.

Grennan taught at Herbert Lehman College, City University of New York, from 1971-1974. In 1974, he accepted a position with Vassar College, where he taught English until his retirement in 2004. During a year's leave from Vassar in 1977, which he spent in Ireland, he began writing poetry seriously for the first time. Grennan published his first volume of poetry, Wildly for Days, in 1983. He has published numerous volumes of poetry since, including What Light There Is (1987), As If It Matters (1991), So It Goes (1995), Relations: New & Selected Poems (1998), Selected & New Poems (2000), The Quick of It (2005), Out of Breath (2007), Matter of Fact (2008), and Out of Sight: New and Selected Poems (2010). His What Light There Is and Other Poems (1989) was a finalist for a Los Angeles Times Book Prize, and Still Life with Waterfall (2002) won the Lenore Marshall Poetry Prize in 2003.

Grennan has also edited several volumes including New Irish Writing: Essays in Memory of Raymond J. Porter (1989), and Facing the Music: Irish Poetry in the Twentieth Century (2004). He has also translated numerous works by Italian poet Giacomo Leopardi, as well as an edition of Oedipus at Colonus (2004) on which he partnered with Kitzinger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of the personal and literary papers of Eamon Grennan from 1943-2010. The papers include a small amount of correspondence and personal papers; writings by Grennan; writings by others; diaries; printed material; and photographs. Correspondence is limited, but includes editorial correspondence, letters from colleagues and other writers including Peter Fallon and Ann Roesnes, and personal correspondence from friends and family. Personal papers include biographical information about Grennan such as his curriculum vitae and bibliography, as well as appointment books and contracts.

Writings by Grennan form the bulk of the collection and include both Grennan's poetry and prose works, as well as notebooks, lectures, and teaching files. Writings by others consist of literary manuscripts sent to or collected by Grennan from other authors such as Louis Asekoff, Tom MacIntyre, and Desmond O'Grady. Also present are manuscripts of Grennan's translations of other authors' works. The diaries are personal in nature and chronicle Grennan's life and travels. Printed material contains copies of Grennan's published writings, promotional materials relating to his appearances and speaking engagements, and general printed material relating to other authors or topics of interest to Grennan. There are very few photographs in the collection and primarily consist of unidentified people and places.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: (1) Correspondence and personal papers, (2) Writings by Grennan, (3) Writings by others, (4) Diaries, (5) Printed material, and (6) Photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of Grennan's correspondence and personal papers from 1961-2010. The correspondence is limited but includes editorial correspondence, letters from colleagues and other authors including Peter Fallon and Ann Roesnes, and personal correspondence from friends and family. Personal papers primarily consist of biographical information about Grennan, as well as Grennan's bibliography and curriculum vitae, appointment books, and contracts.
Additional editorial correspondence can be found in Series 2: Writings by Grennan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Correspondence is arranged in chronological order. Personal papers are arranged in alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Series 1: Letters by Seamus Heaney are closed to researchers.
Due to privacy concerns, some materials in the series have been redacted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of writings by Eamon Grennan from 1962-2010, including poetry, prose, notebooks, and lecture and teaching files. The poetry series contains collected works, as well as uncollected, some of which were published in journals and magazines. Over the years, Grennan also maintained files containing drafts of his poems which he arranged in chronological order. This original arrangement has been preserved, though items may duplicate drafts found elsewhere in the subseries.

The series also contains Grennan's prose writings such as essays, articles, reviews, short stories, and papers written while he was a graduate student at Harvard. Also present in the series are notebooks that contain both poetry and prose, drafts of invited lectures, material relating to poetry readings given by Grennan, and files from courses that he taught. Lecture files include drafts as well as reference material. Teaching files may contain syllabi, notes and assignments.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into five subseries: (2.1) Poetry, (2.2) Prose, (2.3) Notebooks, and (2.4) Lectures, readings, and teaching files, (2.5) Translations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of Grennan's poetry from 1962-2010 and is comprised of collected and uncollected poetry, as well as translations of Grennan's poetry by others. The collected poetry subseries (Subseries 2.2a) includes drafts of individual poems, draft typescripts of whole works, proofs, front matter, some editorial correspondence, and other materials relating to the publication process. The uncollected poetry and translations subseries (Subseries 2.1b) contains uncollected poems, some of which were individually published in journals and magazines. It also includes several French translations of Grennan's poetry by Mich√®le Duclos. The chronological poetry drafts subseries (Subseries 2.1c) consists of drafts of poems arranged chronologically by Grennan. Poems in this subseries may duplicate poems found in the subseries for both collected and uncollected poetry.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: (2.1a) Collected poetry, (2.1b) Uncollected poetry, and (2.1c) Chronological poetry drafts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries contains poetry from published and unpublished collected works, as well as materials pertaining to the publication process. The collected poetry is arranged in chronological order by publication date and includes drafts of individual poems, as well as drafts of whole typescripts, proofs, front matter, and some editorial correspondence. Grennan frequently changed the title of a collection during the process of compiling and revising the typescript. Typescripts with these variant titles have been arranged in alphabetical order within each work, with different drafts in chronological order to the extent that could be determined.

Most collected works also include working files that contain poems considered for publication in that work but which ultimately were not included. Some also include working files titled "Towards [work]," as labeled by Grennan. The original arrangement of these folders has been retained to preserve evidence of early drafting efforts. Many poems in the subseries have multiple drafts which may be located with typescripts of a complete work, working files, and the folder for that individual poem. Not all collected works contain all of these materials.

The series also contains typescript drafts of other collected works, including unpublished works and small collections of poems published together in journals. Most of the unpublished works are from the 1970s, and were compiled by Grennan for personal reasons, such as to commemorate his wife's birthday.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Collected works are arranged in chronological order, with folders arranged within each work as follows: poetry in alphabetical order; followed by all other folders in alphabetical order, with the chronological order of typescript drafts retained whenever possible.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries contains uncollected poems by Grennan. Some of these poems were published in journals and magazines. Most poems have multiple drafts with revisions, which are arranged in the same folder. The majority of the drafts are undated, so internal organization does not reflect draft order in most cases. Duplicate folder titles in the container list reflect Grennan's reuse of the same titles for different poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries contains drafts of poems arranged chronologically by Grennan from 1962-2008. Grennan's original arrangement has been preserved, with the exception that poems have been arranged alphabetically within each folder. The dates on folders often overlap, such that a poem might appear in multiple folders within a given date range. This subseries, while not a comprehensive collection of all of Grennan's poems, reveals the scope of his work throughout his career.
The poems in this subseries might also duplicate poems located in Subseries 2.1a: Collected poetry and Subseries 2.1b: Uncollected poetry.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in chronological order, with poems arranged alphabetically within each folder.

did.unittitle: 2006 October-2008 November, fourth and fifth revisions, A-R
2006 October-2008 November, fourth and fifth revisions, S-Y

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of Grennan's prose writings from 1964-2010. Some of Grennan's early writings can be found in this subseries, including several short stories that he wrote while in Italy in 1964, numerous academic papers he wrote while a student at Harvard University in the 1960s, and his doctoral dissertation. Also included are reviews of books, introductions for readings by other authors, and various articles, essays, and other prose pieces.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The subseries consists of notebooks kept by Grennan from the 1960s-2006. It includes a few academic notebooks about the Renaissance that Grennan wrote while he was a student at Harvard in the late 1960s. The majority of the notebooks, however, contain poetry and other writings, as well as miscellaneous notes.

did.unittitle: Circa late 1960s, primary sources from the Renaissance
Circa late 1960s, secondary works on humanism, art, etc. during the Renaissance
Lectures, poetry readings, and teaching filest, circa 1980s-2009

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of files relating to lectures and poetry readings given by Eamon Grennan, and classes and workshops taught by Grennan. Lecture files include notes and drafts, as well as supplementary material relating to the topic. These files document invited lectures given outside a classroom setting. Poetry reading files include information about the event, as well as the poems Grennan read. Teaching files may include syllabi, notes for lectures, reading assignments and research material. Some courses have been identified, however most files could not be tied to a single course offering and are instead arranged independently by subject.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series contains poems and plays written by other authors and translated by Grennan. Of particular note are materials relating to Sophocles's Oedipus at Colonus, translated by Grennan and Rachel Kitzinger and published in 2005. Also present are Grennan's translations of poems by Giacomo Leopardi, Eugenio Montale, and others. The subseries also contains translations of Grennan's poems in French, as translated by Mich√®le Duclos.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of literary manuscripts written by other authors and sent to or collected by Grennan from 1969-2010. The series includes writings by others about Grennan, including interviews, introductions of Grennan, and reviews of Grennan's works. The series also contains poetry and prose pieces by other authors such as Louis Asekoff, Seamus Heaney, Tom MacIntyre, and Desmond O'Grady, that were sent to or collected by Grennan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of 171 diaries kept by Grennan from 1962-2008. The diaries are of a personal nature and consist primarily of Grennan's thoughts and reflections. There is a minimal amount of poetry included in the volumes. Grennan titled many of his early diaries and these titles are included when present. Grennan also numbered his diaries; numbers appear in brackets following the date or title of the journal. According to notes supplied by Grennan, diary number 96 was lost on a train.

userestrict.head: Terms Governing Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Special restrictions apply: Researchers may not quote from diaries in Series 4 without written permission from Grennan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of printed material relating to Grennan, including printed material by Grennan, printed material about Grennan, material about Grennan's readings and appearances, and various other printed material. Printed material by Grennan primarily consists of published articles, essays, and reviews written by the poet. Printed material about Grennan consists of published articles, essays, interviews, reviews, and clippings written by others about Grennan's life and work. The series also includes flyers and programs relating to Grennan's readings and public appearances. Other printed material includes published works by other authors (often with inscriptions to Grennan), clippings relating to topics of interest to Grennan, and works translated by Grennan.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical and chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The series consists of photographs of Grennan's travels, as well as a slide of a painting of Eamon Grennan by artist Anne Minich.

did.unittitle: Eamon at the Front by Anne Minich, 1988-1989
